TED: TED: Ideas worth spreadingPopular Science stuff? PopSci: Popular Science HomepageFree stuff?: YouTube: YouTubeThere are many more, for sure. These were the ones that were on top of my head.

These are some of the popular free apps/websites I’d recommend for teachers and students to try it out: Animaker Edify - Teachers can use this free app to create engaging video lessons. It does not require any design skills. Videos can be created within minutes. Also, helps teachers assign creative tasks to students! Kahoot - If you want to make your classroom assessment more fun try this app! It helps in gamifying your content. Haiku Deck - Helps teachers to create presentation based lessons. Supports your lessons with YouTube videos. Edmodo - As a teacher this tool helps you analyze students performance one-one. Build personalized tests to help them cope up. Hope you found the answer useful!
